definition: to yearn for sth even in one's dreams (idiom)/to long for sth day and night
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to sleep soundly
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: It was powder blue and sleek[1] looking.The kind of car you dream about.
sentences.chinese: 粉蓝色的车身闪着光芒，绝对是人们梦寐以求的车。

sentences.english: One superpower all psychologists would kill for is the ability to read minds.
sentences.chinese: “读心术”是每个心理学家都梦寐以求的超能力。

sentences.english: That might help it find a little more of the entrepreneurial vim it craves.
sentences.chinese: 这也许会助其得到一点点其梦寐以求的企业家精神。

sentences.english: When do you want to buy that dream house?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候买你梦寐以求的房子？

sentences.english: You are a dream to work with.
sentences.chinese: 能够与你共事，是我梦寐以求的事情。

sentences.english: It has been a long-cherished wish for the Chinese people to realize modernization.
sentences.chinese: 实现现代化是中国人民梦寐以求的夙愿。

sentences.english: These are the issues the people in the region desperately need.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是本地区人民梦寐以求的。

sentences.english: I have had my “China dream” for years, now I am here to realize this dream.
sentences.chinese: 我多年梦寐以求的中国梦，竟然可以在此得以实现。

sentences.english: The simple truth is that China is hell-bent on world domination.
sentences.chinese: 事实很简单，中国对于控制世界梦寐以求。

sentences.english: The sea Tao sound is yearning for which howmany people longs for even in dreams.
sentences.chinese: 大海的涛声是多少人梦寐以求的向往。

sentences.english: Sometimes your castoff are other people's treasure.
sentences.chinese: 有时你丢弃的东西是别人梦寐以求的宝贝。

sentences.english: His long-cherished dream is to pursue his master's degree in Cambridge University.
sentences.chinese: 他梦寐以求的是去剑桥大学攻读硕土学位。

sentences.english: The origin of OK became the Holy Grail of etymology.
sentences.chinese: Ok的出典成了词源学梦寐以求的圣杯。

sentences.english: On the back of the pack to the distance, the dream destination.
sentences.chinese: 背上行囊去远方，那个梦寐以求的目的地。

sentences.english: Qian Zhongshu s notion of "transformation" is the ideal goal that many translators are keen to attain.
sentences.chinese: “化境”是众多翻译工作者梦寐以求的理想目标。

sentences.english: Mason had been overwhelmingly elected to the judgeship which he had so craved.
sentences.chinese: 梅森以压倒的票数当选他梦寐以求的法官。

definition: in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: to have one's wish fulfilled
in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible/also written 可望而不可及[ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2]
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: to yearn for sth day and night (idiom)
easily obtained/readily available
to water at the mouth/to drool
to yearn for/to look forward to
to thirst for/to long for
to envy/to admire
to treasure/to be very fond of
to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
supreme/paramount/unsurpassed
to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
to admire
to envy/to admire
